Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • Item
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ball, Brick, Pad, Powerup

    public abstract class Item
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class to define the basic things that all game items must have. This class has a position, a size and a speed. In the case of a subclass not needing one or more of these properties, it should override the getters and setters of these properties, defining them to throw an error instead of returning a value.
    Version:
    2013-05-14
    Author:
    Jonathan Olergård, Jack Shabo

      • Item

        public Item(int coordX,
    int coordY,
    int sizeX,
    int sizeY,
    int speedX,
    int speedY)
        Create a new Item object with given values.
        Parameters:
        coordX - X-coordinate of this object.
        coordY - Y-coordinate of this object.
        sizeX - Size in X-axis.
        sizeY - Size in Y-axis.
        speedX - The speed of this object, in x-axis terms.
        speedY - The speed of this object, in y-axis terms.
